meanings.definition: To disturb or interfere with someone or something in an unwelcome or harmful way.
meanings.sent1: The loud noise outside continued to molest my concentration while I was studying.
meanings.sent2: Please do not molest the fragile ecosystem by littering in the park.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel seemed to molest the peaceful birds by stealing their food.
meanings.sent4: The relentless rain seemed to molest the tranquility of the countryside.
meanings.sent5: The persistent mosquito would constantly molest me during my camping trip.

meanings.definition: To sexually abuse or harass someone, especially a child.
meanings.sent1: It is important to teach children about body boundaries to prevent anyone from trying to molest them.
meanings.sent2: The predator was arrested for attempting to molest a minor in the park.
meanings.sent3: The clumsy magician accidentally made it seem like the rabbit was trying to molest the audience.
meanings.sent4: The dark shadow in the alley seemed to molest the sense of safety in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent5: The sinister character in the movie would constantly try to molest the innocence of the protagonist.
